questions.question: I will wait here until she ______ back.
When he ______, we will start the meeting.
We were having dinner when the phone ______.
She ______ her homework before she watched TV yesterday.
As soon as I ______ the news, I will tell you.
My mother was cooking while my father ______ the newspaper.
Identify the mistake: 'When I will grow up, I will be a doctor.'
Identify the dependent clause: 'They will go out after they finish their work.'
Which sentence has the correct punctuation?
options: As soon as we get there, we will call you.
As soon as we get there we will call you.
We will call you, as soon as we get there.
We, will call you as soon as we get there.
questions.answer: As soon as we get there, we will call you.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence regarding tense usage:
options: I will buy a car when I have enough money.
I will buy a car when I will have enough money.
I buy a car when I will have enough money.
I bought a car when I have enough money.
questions.answer: I will buy a car when I have enough money.
